DOC.brief_title: FeverText : Assessing Fever Rates After Vaccination During 2011-12 Influenza Season Using Text Messaging
DOC.criteria: 1. 6 23 month old , 2. visit study site study period Nov. 1 , 2011 March 31 , 2012 , 3. receive trivalent inactivate influenza vaccine ( TIV ) /13valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine ( PCV13 ) concomitantly , trivalent inactivate influenza vaccine ( TIV ) /without 13valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine ( PCV13 ) 13valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine ( PCV13 ) without trivalent inactivate influenza vaccine ( TIV ) / ( 4 ) parent cell phone text messaging capability ; ( 5 ) parent speak English Spanish . Exclusion criterion : 1. presence fever > =100.4 time vaccination ; 2. administration antipyretic 6hour period prior vaccination 3. state intent use prophylactic antipyretic time vaccination development fever ; 4. state intention move away NYC area < 6 month ; 5. parent speaks language English Spanish ; 6. inability read text message ; 7. child receive live attenuate influenza vaccine ( LAIV ) visit ; 8. child receive trivalent inactivate influenza vaccine ( TIV ) 13valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine ( PCV13 ) seven day prior enrollment date Note : Patient may receive vaccine addition trivalent inactivate influenza vaccine ( TIV ) /13valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine ( PCV13 )
